meanings.definition: Capable of being wasted or used up.
meanings.sent1: The old newspapers were wastable and ready to be recycled.
meanings.sent2: Food that is left uneaten becomes wastable and should not be wasted.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her time watching TV was so wastable, she could have learned a new skill instead.
meanings.sent4: His talent for painting was so wastable that he could create masterpieces effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The opportunities in front of him were so wastable that he had to choose wisely.

meanings.definition: Able to be disposed of as waste.
meanings.sent1: The plastic bottles were wastable and needed to be thrown in the recycling bin.
meanings.sent2: The used tissues were wastable and should be discarded properly.
meanings.sent3: The broken toy was so wastable that it ended up in the trash without a second thought.
meanings.sent4: Her old clothes were so wastable that she decided to donate them to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The disposable cups were so wastable that they were used once and then thrown away.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being wasted or squandered.
meanings.sent1: His free time was wastable, so he spent it playing video games.
meanings.sent2: Money that is not wisely spent becomes wastable and leads to financial troubles.
meanings.sent3: The opportunity to travel was so wastable that she decided to explore new destinations.
meanings.sent4: Her potential was so wastable that she knew she had to make the most of every chance she got.
meanings.sent5: The resources were so wastable that they needed to be managed carefully to avoid depletion.
